DEV Console.description: Enables detailed Max console output for development and debugging. DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION.

DEV Info.description: Shows texture info for development purposes

PX FX Alpha.description: Alpha channel tools: chroma key, mapping, inversion, smoothing, removal, etc.

PX FX Blur.description: Four blur shaders from Max/Jitter stock collection

PX FX Colorize.description: Two/tri tone colorization with multiple mapping methods

PX FX Convert.description: Texture format conversion including OKLAB and normalized OKLAB aka NOKLAB

PX FX Delay.description: Frame-based texture delay. Combine with Mix Dry device for ghost trail effects.

PX FX Kaleidoscope.description: Kaleidoscope patterns based on [Brewster designs]((https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kaleidoscope#Different_versions_suggested_by_Brewster)) plus Max/Jitter shader

PX FX Pass.description: Postprocessing shaders from Max/Jitter stock library. See [Max documentation](https://docs.cycling74.com/reference/jit.gl.pass).

PX FX Pixelization.description: Multi-shape pixelization: rectangular, circular, honeycomb, hexagonal, triangular grids

PX FX Transform.description: Geometric transformations: scale, shift, rotation (around axis or vector)

PX GEN Cos Pattern.description: Procedural patterns with cosine palettes [popularized](https://iquilezles.org/articles/palettes/) by Inigo Quilez

PX GEN Sketching.description: Custom OpenGL primitives scripting with JavaScript, slightly compatible with [openprocessing.org](https://openprocessing.org/)

PX GEN Text.description: Text generation from session/clip names, custom text, or dynamic musical data (beat, bar.beat, time)

PX IN Cam.description: Live input from connected video devices

PX IN Channel.description: Use texture from [Mix Channel](#px-mix-channel) as input. Creates feedback when combined with [Mix Dry](#px-mix-dry) on same channel.

PX IN Image.description: Static image input. Supports JPG, WEBP and PNG formats.

PX IN Mix.description: Use channel mix from [Mix View](#px-mix-view) device as input texture.

PX IN SVG.description: Vector graphics input with resolution-independent scaling SVG file formal

PX IN Syphon.description: [Syphon](https://syphon.info/) input for sharing visuals between applications. Mac only.

PX IN Video.description: Video playback. Supports MP4, AVI, MOV (including [HAP codecs](https://hap.video/)).

PX Mix Channel.description: Send texture to selected channel. Alternative to individual channel selectors on each device.

PX Mix Dry.description: Dry/wet mix from two previous devices. Select which (-1 to -4) for dry signal. Multiple blend modes and signal swap. Swap has no effect on [commutative](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commutative_property) blending methods.

PX Mix Transition.description: Transition between two previous devices. Channel selection same as Mix Dry. Uses 90+ transitions from [gl-transitions.com](https://gl-transitions.com/).

PX Mix View.description: Multi-channel mixing and preview. Mix output selected in expanded section can be consumed by [IN Mix](#in-mix) device and [Syphon](https://syphon.info/) clients. Click preview for floating window, <kbd>ESC</kbd> for fullscreen on/off.

PX Route Audio.description: Route audio from any track in your Live set

PX Route MIDI.description: Send MIDI from selected track to next device. Works with [PX Shader](#px-shader) device and MIDI-enabled shaders.

PX Shader.description: Interactive Shader Format ([ISF](https://isf.video/)) host for generators and effects. Up to 32 dynamic parameters and various audio rendering options with our custom audio types.

PX World.description: Essential rendering context. You need exactly one per Live set. More would be problematic. Sets target FPS. FPS 0 will use available maximum with displaylink turned on on Mac.
